text:
<@U6A936746> that actually isn’t quite true. it was true a couple of years ago; isn’t true now.

<https://talonvoice.com/> has its own speech engines that are under active development (though I personally use Talon with Dragon). Talon basically allows you to easily make a speech DSL / speech macros for anything, including latex; it also comes with an eyetracking driver. There are professional SWEs who do most, in some cases even all, of their professional coding using Talon.

(Also, I’m not the only Julia lang user using Talon either!)

text:
I have listened to a talk about accessible input recently, with pointers to further resources. Here it is: <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t_nC4sUwXno>
As shown in the talk, if you want to invest the time for it up front (to get everything working right), it is totally possible, for writing LaTeX as well as Julia.
As a first pointer, here is an example demonstration "Coding by Voice" using a project called <https://github.com/daanzu/kaldi-active-grammar|kaldi-active-grammar> , presented by its author, who allegedly has a speech impediment: <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qk1mGbIJx3s> (this is also shown in the talk above, starting around 25:30)
